node.title: Concerns about new COVID-19 variant see ASX fall
node.description: The ASX is in for a second day of losses as investors worry about the new COVID-19 variant Omicron.Â
node.content: ["The ASX has dropped in early trading as investors worry about the new COVID-19 variant Omicron.", "After an hour of trade, the benchmark ASX 200 was down\u00a0by 0.7\u00a0per cent\u00a0to 7,230, with the All Ordinaries off by the same percentage.", "Those falls come\u00a0as news of the new COVID-19 variant, Omicron, prompted a sell-off on Friday.\u00a0", "All sectors were in the red in early trading.\u00a0", "Travel-related stocks are in for a\u00a0bad day,\u00a0as investors look to make an exit from companies that would be affected by new COVID-19 restrictions, in favour of\u00a0health stocks.\u00a0", "Top movers were Sonic Healthcare (+2.6pc), Healius (+2.5pc), Ansell Limited (+1.8pc), Fisher & Paykel Healthcare (+1.1pc) and Transurban (+1pc).\u00a0", "Flight Centre Travel Group led the losses, down 8.7\u00a0per cent. Others stocks trending downwards\u00a0were shopping centre owner Unibail-Rodamco-Westfield (-7.1pc), Webjet (-7.1pc), Woodside Petroleum (-6.7pc) and Nickel Mines (-5.7pc).\u00a0", "On oil markets, West Texas crude was up 3 per cent\u00a0to $US70.27 a barrel, while the global benchmark Brent crude price rose 2.2 per cent\u00a0to $US74.63.\u00a0", "The spot gold price was down 0.1 per cent\u00a0to $US1,783.\u00a0", "US markets tumbled on Friday, with the\u00a0Dow Jones losing\u00a02.5 per cent. The Nasdaq and S&P 500 fell\u00a0around 2.2 per cent."]
